headline: Mall Pretzels
description: Those big, soft pretzels rolled in coarse salt are yours to bake at home with basic bread ingredients you probably already have in your pantry.

video.name: We Tried Making Mall Pretzels from Scratch

name: Mall Pretzels
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
2 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, dissolve the yeast, brown sugar and salt in 1 1/2 cups warm water. Stir in flour, and knead dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, and turn to coat the surface. Cover, and let rise for one hour.
Combine 2 cups warm water and baking soda in an 8 inch square pan. Line 6 baking sheets with parchment paper.

After dough has risen, cut into 12 pieces. Roll each piece into a 3 foot rope, pencil thin or thinner. Twist into a pretzel shape, and dip into the baking soda solution. Place onto parchment covered baking sheets, and let rise 15 to 20 minutes.
Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Brush with melted butter, and sprinkle with coarse salt, garlic salt or cinnamon sugar.

review.reviewBody: A+
My kids loved this recipe. We had fun making it.

This was my 1st time attempt at making pretzels, overall simple enough and easy to follow instructions. It took longer than the time estimates included on the website, but I feel that's due to it being the first time having tried this particular recipe. I will try it again.

Thank you! I always wanted to make these and now I know how! I did make a change though, I used sourdough starter instead of yeast and they came out great! Now I need to perfect my rolling skills! I am afraid most of them don't look as good as the ones pictured.
I’ve been making this recipe for years, it’s a family favourite. 5 Stars.
Great texture and taste. Loved them.
Very tasty , and Dough worked perfectly, I had No course salt …. So I used “ pink H. salt “ worked great! Yummy
Great recipes! After twisting up the naked pretzels put them on a spatula before dipping them into the baking soda mix. It’s much easier that way
I loved the pretzels, but if you don't spray the parchment paper, the pretzels will stick.

It was so much fun making these with my grandson. They turned out a little crispier than we liked. I think next time we won’t roll them so thin and cook them less. Leave them about an inch thick and cook for 8 minutes and then maybe they’ll be softer.

DO NOT USE PARCHMENT PAPER!!! My pretzels stuck to the paper and I couldn't get them off. So I lost 5 pretzels. Also someone suggested boiling the baking soda and water and placing the pretzels in there before baking them. They instantly fell apart when you try to take them out. The water cooked it, and preventing some of them from raising completely. I should've stuck to the original recipe and used a non-stick pan.

Great recipe. Easy to follow. They did not grow large so I did not need 2 per tray, I could put 4 on a tray. And no parchment needed either. I feel my oven is not as hot as some so I should have cooked it for 9-10min instead of just 8, although 8 min was cooked (just browned).

I love this recipe! I have made it twice in 3 days, my family can’t get enough! I didn’t modify the recipe in anyway, although I did add the salt with the flour instead of with the yeast and brown sugar (since salt kills yeast.) I used my stand mixer to knead the dough for 8 min on the second setting. It was perfect! I had no issues rolling them out on my granite countertop. If your dough sticks you might not be greasing the bowl and dough enough. I can get 4 on a cookie sheet with parchment (was better at it the second time). So good!
turned out very good....took flashsmith's advice......thanks
Mine failed terribly
This recipe is great! Thank you for sharing!
These are amazing I did some regular and some some cinnamon sugar and me and my family love them I will definitely make them again
Need to work on my dough skills but these are pretty good! Suggestion- if you choose to brown them under the broiler- remove the parchment paper.
These turned out amazing but more flour was needed to make the dough. I recommend using garlic salt at the end!
These were delicious. We made pretzel bites. We added sugar and cinnamon to some and salt to others. We will make them again.
I didn’t change a thing about the recipe. I just made sure to let them rest and ride for a good long time. Delicious and chewy with a nice crisp outer!!

Okay! This is Literally the best thing EVER. I totally recommend this! It’s really easy, but does take a long time, most of it is just waiting. I love it, and I am gonna totally make it again!! Have fun, I hope you like it if you choose to make it!

Fantastic recipe. I’ve made lots of pretzels these were the best so far. The one thing I did with the baking soda was was to brush it on instead of soaking them in the baking soda. It worked great and is far less precarious

Turned out perfect on the second try.-
- don’t put flour on the board while rolling
- put in the baking soda bath before shaping
My picky family loved these! I made exactly according to instructions. I didn’t have bread flour but found I could add gluten to all purpose flour to make it. Worked perfectly.
Seriously so good! The one thing I do different is I boil water to add the baking soda in, and I let the dough boil for 30 seconds to a minutes. I made pretzel bites!

This was a fun easy recipe to make with my kids. We loved it! Tasted better than the Mall. We made salted and cinnamon sugar. We baked them on parchment paper. I found if you have left overs leave them plain and reheat in the oven.
I used a bread machine to make the dough. And I brushed with butter and sprinkled with the salt prior to baking. Everyone loved them.
Absolutely loved this, instructions are spot on. Will definitely make it again. The wife was impressed.
I will make again!
These tasted so much like the mall pretzels. We had fun with them. They only lasted 2 days before they started to mold. I easily ate 2 right away.
So delicious! My dough didn't rise but they were still awesome!!!
I will love to make it again.
Easy recipe to follow! Yummy!

Great recipe. Loved by all. When I remake (without question), I will roll the dough out to a thicker size (2' rather than 3') to allow for a doughier texture. Regardless, the original size was very well received.
Perfect! Thank you!

Made this during coronavirus social distancing for my husband and brother. They turned out soooo good. I boiled them for 30 seconds in baking soda and boiled water as suggested, brushed with egg wash and topped with salt and various toppings before baking them. They were devoured. Thank you for the recipe. So delicious.

My daughter wanted to make pretzels like the ones she's always buying from the mall. I saw this recipe called "Mall pretzels" with 1000 reviews and it sounded perfect! The pretzels were very easy to make and turned out absolutely perfectly! We made traditional pretzel shaped pretzels as well as pretzel bites. So good! This recipe will definitely become a family favourite.
Perfect! made some cheese sauce to go with them. They were super easy and fun to do with the kids.

I made these pretzels, but I was an inexperienced bread baker at the time. Rolling them out was a challenge, however, they did turn out pretty good, albeit not so pretty. Then I got lazy and just decided to make bread rolls, and skip the water bath step. Wow! They tasted just like the bread rolls my husband and I would rave about when eating at a certain hotel restaurant. The crust was crispy and the crumb tasty and chewy. From that point, I got braver and modified the recipe by changing out half the flour to whole wheat or graham flour (yum). I switched out the water for milk and even coffee; put less liquid and added an egg. I added seeds, fruit, oatmeal. This recipe is VERY FORGIVING. 
It sure gave me the confidence to experiment. The basic dough is a pleasure to knead. Just make sure you handle it gently or it will tend to stick and you'll be driven to keep adding flour. I like to tell others, "knead as if the dough were hot to the touch". Hope this helps. Best wishes to all ye bread bakers!
Made the recipe as is! So good! If we don’t finish all I plan to freeze to keep fresh.
Turns out more like pretzel bread than actual mall pretzels, but it was still great!
Excellent

I made it and they were sooooo good. 
The flavour was incredible! 
My family gobbled them up
Easy to make the dough! Baked perfectly the first try! A new family favourite!!!
OMG MY FAMILY AND I LOVED THEM SO MUCH THAT WE HAD TO ARM WRESTLE OVER THE LAST ONE.

Followed the recipe and made no changes and they came out stellar! Absolutely loved these and will make again! They’re a little crunchier than mall pretzels, but I enjoyed the slight crunch and will make again

These came out perfect!! I didn't make any changes. I was nervous to try these at first because I was thinking they would be complicated with so many steps. But they were very easy to make and it was a super fun activity with the kids. My kids actually rolled out and shaped all the pretzels themselves. We followed the tip to roll them half way, let them rest, then roll out the rest of the way - it worked great.
I Doubled the recipe and still came out perfect
These are so good. Will definitely make again.

We made these with beer cheese. YUM! IF you have baking experience, you will have no trouble. I just about died when I read the review that used wax paper in a 450 oven. Like many have said, boil them in water and baking soda. I baked mine on parchment with no spray and they turned out beautifully. The key to any "bread" is the proofing and kneading. if you haven't got the patience to do it right, then don't bother doing it. Apparently people need to he told to use a floured surface to knead dough. Anyways, I will definitely be making these over and over.
Follow Ed the recipe to the T and they came out perfect

I really liked this recipe. The pretzels came out just the way I had hoped. It's a convenient recipe to make, with easily available ingredients. The only change I would make is to add the salt before baking. That way the salt will stick to the pretzel better.

Great pretzels! I made half of mine with garlic and salt, served with queso blanco. The other half was cinnamon and sugar served with home made cream cheese frosting. Im never buying mall pretzels again!
Yummy! And so easy. My batter was not quite firm enough to shape into pretzel shapes so I just made sticks. Tasted great!

I have made this 3 times, and my father-in-law and husband both really love it. I also enjoy it, but I don't think this is the kind of thing you want to save for later or have leftover. Much better fresh in my opinion.
Not a pro at all. But these came out amazing. The recipe was easy to follow.

I made these as the recipe called for, my only change would be not to follow the length and diameter the recipe called for. I found the length was way to long, so I shortened it and made it bigger around, came out more like a pretzel.Other than that good recipe.

WOW real mall pretzels without having to go into the mall!! I had no issues with the dough but had no bread flour, so I used all purpose but added a rounded Tbsp of vital wheat gluten. I used the dough setting on my bread machine and it mixed it perfectly. The note about rolling to half the length and letting it rest, then rolling the rest of the way, was very helpful. I then followed one reviewer's instructions to boil the pretzels in 4 cups water with 4 tablespoons baking soda until they float. After taking it out I set them on Wire racks and let them rise. Then I used an egg wash and sprinkled salt on before baking. I baked them right on the racks so I didn't disturb them, and they only stuck a little after baking, not enough to tear or anything. They came out nice and dark and perfect! Yum!

Great recipe! I used instant dry yeast (8oz packet), kneaded it for 1 min by hand, let it rest for 5 mins then started shaping it. I switched out the salt topping with grated parmesan cheese -- it added a nice salty, crunchy texture. These came out crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.
I have made these multiple times- they are gone within the hour... we add more baking soda to get a better “pretzel “ taste- awesome recipe!
yes, I used all purpose flour for both flour amounts and boiled 4 cups of water with 4 TBSP of baking soda to dip the pretzels in before baking. I will be making these again
Delicious. We just popped them out of the oven and in to our mouths. Brushed with butter and used course salt before baking. Very easy recipe for avid bread bakers.

Tastes great; I was hesitant to add so much salt and put probably closer to 1 1/2 tbsp salt. I made a swiss buttercream with some cinnamon added to dip them in and I would highly recommend that for anyone wanting a sweeter and buttery taste similar to Auntie Anne's cinnamon sugar pretzels.
Delish! Took the advice of some reviewers and boiled them in the baking soda mixture, but didn't change anything else. Great with mustard and over the top fabulous with cinnamon and sugar.
It was pretty good I enjoyed him they were buttery and delicious not that hard to make could’ve browned up a little bit better
Really good!!!
Loved them! Double the recipe!

This was a hit! I did a test run prior to an upcoming party to see how it would turn out. I decided to serve them as a little appetizer at my daughter’s birthday party and every last one was eaten! I prepared the dough in my bread maker and baked on parchment and silpats.
Obsessed with these pretzels!!! Super soft and delicious!!
These are very good. I made some pretzels and some buns. The buns had almost a donut flavor to them. Will definitely make again!

Made the dough into pretzel bites .After rising, I divided the dough into four. Rolled each one into equal lengths. Cut into about 9-12 sections and then cut again to make about one inch bites. After baking, I brushed immediately with melted butter. Took as a party appetizer and was the hit out of a huge assortment. Not one left over! Keeper in my recipe box.
These taste just like the pretzels you buy in the malls! So good!
Delicious. A big hit at the Octoberfest party.
My girls and I made these and they were absolutely delicious!! Only thing we changed is added jalapeños to a few ??
I have been making these for years my kids favorite to come home from school to
No changes made. Served with cheese sauce for a dip. Thanks for sharing the recipe! Delicious!
Made these about 5 times now they are soooo goooood! I just use 2.5-3 cups all purpose and 1 cup whole wheat flour and it works great. Thanks for the recipe!

I have made these many times and they never disappoint. They taste and feel exactly like the pretzels you get at the mall! A downside however, it was a little soggy but I think it can be improved with more dry ingredients. Loved these and they are so fun to make with family! :)

So delicious. The only things I changed was that I used brown sugar instead of white sugar and I made 8 extra thick pretzels instead of a dozen. Four on each baking sheet lined with parchment paper, they baked for 15 minutes. These pretzels are absolutely identical to Bavarian Pretzel, if anyone here is familiar with that chain. Maybe next time I'll use bread flour and see if they are more similar to Auntie Annie's, which are softer and chewier. Right out of the oven I basted them in butter and sprinkled lightly with Kosher salt. I'm going to freeze them, whcih is awesome since there are only two of us here. I don't know if these pretzels will live long enough to experiment with different toppings.

My daughter asks me to make these all the time, they are wonderful. We prefer them without the butter and salt. I made pretzel dogs with this recipe as well and they were a big hit! Thank you for sharing this recipe!
Made mistake of using all purpose flour for all of it next time use the bread flour

I've made these several times and am still playing with the recipe. I use the ingredients exactly as listed. For the wash I hold the pretzels by the tips and dip them in and out of the baking soda solution. If it's good enough for a young Mennonite gal I watched making pretzels at a Lancaster County Farmer's Market, then it's good enough for me.

OMG!! Best pretzels ever! My 5 n 7 yr old granddaughters both said Grandpa make these for breakfast tomorrow! Lol. Recipe was perfect, I made following tweaks to cooking process:
1. Mix the brown sugar and 110° water.Do NOT Add salt at this point. Add 1 pack yeast gently, stir n let sit still for @ 20 mins (allows yeast to activate). 2. Add the salt and 4 cups of flour 1 at a time. (I used all AP flour.)3. I used my Kitchen Aide stand mixer with dough hook on 2 n let that run for 5 to 6 minutes.4.Lightly oil the mixing bowl and dough. Place a warm towel over the mixing bowl n let sit to rise for @ 1hr and 15 min. 5. Put dough out on lightly floured cutting board and cut into 12 equal slices. 6. Roll each peice as described in recipe, except my rope was only @ 18 inches or so.I then shaped 6 into pretzel shape n 6 into twists.Sit that aside to rise again for @20 to 25 mins.7. As that was rising I lightly oiled 2 cookie sheets and in a pot bring 4 cups of water and 4 tablespoons of baking soda to a high simmer.8. Put 2 pretzels at a time into water, flip after 30secs and simmer 30 more secs. Remove from pot, shake off excess water(prevents sticking), place on cookie sheets, and sprinkle kosher salt on pretzels. Repeat step for rest of pretzels.9. Bake pretzels for 4 min,remove, brush with melted butter, n bake for @4 more mins. Follow recipe n these steps for best pretzels ever!
Great recipe I roll and make pretzel bites instead leaving the ropes thicker. So good!!
I put the recipe into my bread machine for the dough. I then followed the rest of the instructions and the pretzels turned out super delicious.
Take your time and these will be amazing!

My kids always get a pretzel when we visit the mall, so I was in search of making this myself. After browsing a few recipes, i settled on this one because it was simple and I had everything on hand. I've made this 3 times in less than 2 weeks. As other reviewers have said, you MUST kneed the dough as long as it states (I use my KA mixer with the hook attachment). It makes the mixer jump around, so its best to hold it down or rest the machine on a towel. You MUST let the dough rest for at least the 1 hour. If you did both, then rolling, twisting and shaping should be rather easy. I don't blot the water solution off, since oven is hot enough to dry it off fairly quickly. But I do let the first pan rise while i finish twisting all the other pretzels. As soon as its out of the oven, I brush the tops with a warmed mixture of 4 TB melted butter, 2 TB light brown sugar, 1/2 tsp salt. Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge, i toast it briefly and it still tastes great a few days later.
These were incredible! Family loved them. Cooked for 11 minutes. Topped with butter and then some with Kosher salt and the rest with cinnamon sugar followed by a few sprays of butter spray.
Read the popular reviews to help you get it right. It’s a wonderful recipe.

Easy to make recipe and instructions are easy to follow. I didn’t butter them down after baking or added the coarse salt which made them taste somewhat bland under those circumstances of course. Crisp on the outside and fluffy inside. Making these again!

These pretzels are awesome! I did what other reviews did and boiled these in 4 cups of water and 4 tablespoons of baking soda. I also basted them with egg prior to baking. I did not roll them out to 3 feet as I felt that was too long and thin. I did about 1-1 1/2 feet instead and the result was nice fat pretzels about 1" in diameter. After baking I basted them with butter and ate with Rosarita's nacho cheese sauce. Yum!

I just used regular sugar and flour and followed the instructions. I lined the pans with lard and halfway through the cooking time I flipped them because the bottoms start to brown quickly. Overall, i Baked them for 7-8 minutes each. To get that nice brown colour, melt some butter, sprinkle with salt and broil for 3-5 minutes

trying this recipe but id give it a five star if was more specific as the one package at .25 ounces part should be more specific as if u got the jar of the dry active yeast it needs to be added in that it ='s 2 1/2 tea spoons other then that ill add more detail once i get it done and made as this is first time for me making this one

These were terrific! I followed the directions exactly. Even when my son turned off the oven's alarm without my noticing, the pretzels turned out chewy and delicious despite an extra several minutes of baking time. This was a great (and forgiving) recipe! Thanks.

I've made this recipe so many times I've lost count. This pretzel recipe is definitely a favorite!
I make a double batch and then freeze them. To warm them up I just put one in the toaster oven and keep the rest in the freezer. That way the salt on top doesn't make the pretzel get that "soggy" texture.

We will be making this recipe again. Kneeding by hand was difficult and I will try using my dough hook attachment for my stand mixer next time. Also, I live in a dry climate and needed to add a couple extra tablespoons of water to get the dough to come together.
very easy and tastes just like the real thing. we actually made this recipe two days in a row because it was such a hit!

PARCHMENT PAPER, PARCHMENT PAPER, PARCHMENT PAPER. Must use parchment paper. When used greased, non-stick cookie sheet, stuck like glue. No sicking problems using the parchment paper. I use large cookie sheets and can fit four on one sheet. For easier rolling, roll out half length, let rest a couple of minutes, then roll out rest of way. Stick tails down well to bottom or will come untwisted when removing from baking soda/water solution. Tasty treat. Taste best when consumed same day. Got soggy next day.
